declarations.comments:
Representation of a physical quantity as a (product of a) numerical value
and a physical unit.
declarations.title: Quantity

declarations.comments:
Construct a physical quantity from a numerical value and the physical
unit.
declarations.title: quantity

declarations.comments:
Construct a physical quantity from a numerical value and the physical
unit.
declarations.title: quantity'

declarations.comments:
Show a physical quantity in a human-readable form, value and unit
separately.
declarations.title: prettyPrint'

declarations.comments: Show a physical quantity in a human-readable form.
declarations.title: prettyPrint

declarations.comments: Show the (possibly failed) result of a computation in human-readable form.
declarations.title: showResult

declarations.comments: The unit of a physical quantity.
declarations.title: derivedUnit

declarations.comments: Convert a quantity to its standard representation.
declarations.title: toStandard

declarations.comments: Simplify the unit of a quantity.
declarations.title: fullSimplify

declarations.comments:
Check whether two quantities have matching units (or can be converted
to the same representation) and test if the numerical values are
approximately equal.
declarations.title: approximatelyEqual

declarations.comments:
A unit conversion error that appears if two given units cannot be
converted into each other.
declarations.title: UnificationError

declarations.comments: Textual representation of a unit conversion error.
declarations.title: errorMessage

declarations.comments: Create a scalar (i.e. dimensionless) quantity from a number.
declarations.title: scalar

declarations.comments: Create a scalar (i.e. dimensionless) quantity from a number.
declarations.title: scalar'

declarations.comments:
Attempt to convert a physical quantity to a given target unit. Returns a
`UnificationError` if the conversion fails.
declarations.title: convert

declarations.comments:
Get the numerical value of a physical quantity in a given unit. Returns a
`UnificationError` if the conversion fails.
declarations.title: asValueIn'

declarations.comments:
Get the numerical value of a physical quantity in a given unit. Returns a
`UnificationError` if the conversion fails.
declarations.title: asValueIn

declarations.comments: Try to convert a quantity to a scalar value
declarations.title: toScalar'

declarations.comments: Try to convert a quantity to a scalar value
declarations.title: toScalar

declarations.comments: Check if the numerical value of a quantity is finite.
declarations.title: isFinite

declarations.comments: Negate the numerical value of a quantity.
declarations.title: qNegate

declarations.comments:
Attempt to add two quantities. If the units can not be unified, an error
is returned.
declarations.title: qAdd

declarations.comments:
Attempt to subtract two quantities. If the units can not be unified, an
error is returned.
declarations.title: qSubtract

declarations.comments: Raise a quantity to a given power.
declarations.title: pow

declarations.comments: The absolute value of a quantity.
declarations.title: abs

declarations.comments: The square root of a quantity.
declarations.title: sqrt

declarations.comments: The speed of light in vacuum.
declarations.title: speedOfLight

declarations.comments: A number that represents a power of ten as a prefix for a unit.
declarations.title: Prefix

declarations.comments:
A generic physical unit. The `Semigroup`/`Monoid` instance implements
multiplication of units.

Implementation detail:
A `DerivedUnit` is a product of `BaseUnits`, raised to arbitrary powers.
Each factor also has a `Prefix` value which represents a numerical
prefix as a power of ten.
declarations.title: DerivedUnit

declarations.comments: Add a given prefix value to a unit: `withPrefix 3.0 meter = kilo meter`.
declarations.title: withPrefix

declarations.comments:
Simplify the internal representation of a `DerivedUnit` by merging base
units of the same type. For example, *m·s·m* will by simplified to *m²·s*.
declarations.title: simplify

declarations.comments: Helper function to create a standard unit.
declarations.title: makeStandard

declarations.comments: Helper function to create a non-standard unit.
declarations.title: makeNonStandard

declarations.comments:
Convert all contained units to standard units and return the global
conversion factor.
declarations.title: toStandardUnit

declarations.comments: Get the name of a SI-prefix.
declarations.title: prefixName

declarations.comments: Raise a unit to the given power.
declarations.title: power

declarations.comments:
A `DerivedUnit` corresponding to `1`, i.e. the unit of scalar
(or dimensionless) values.
declarations.title: unity

modules.name: Data.Units.Imperial
modules.comments: A collection units of the imperial system.

modules.name: Data.Units.SI
modules.comments: A collection of standardized SI units.

declarations.comments: The meter is the standard unit of length.
declarations.title: meter

declarations.comments: One gram equals one-thousandth of a *kilogram*.
declarations.title: gram

declarations.comments: The kilogram is the standard unit of mass.
declarations.title: kilogram

declarations.comments: The second is the standard unit of time.
declarations.title: second

declarations.comments: The ampere is the standard unit of electric current.
declarations.title: ampere

declarations.comments: The mole is the standard unit for amount of substance.
declarations.title: mole

declarations.comments: The kelvin is the standard unit of temperature.
declarations.title: kelvin

declarations.comments: The candela is the standard unit of luminous intensity.
declarations.title: candela

modules.name: Data.Units.SI.Accepted
modules.comments: A collection of non-SI units that are accepted by the SI brochure.

declarations.comments: 'Dimensionless' unit for angles *360 degree = 2 pi rad*.
declarations.title: degree

modules.name: Data.Units.SI.Derived
modules.comments: A collection of units that are derived from SI units.

modules.name: Data.Units.Time
modules.comments: A collection of units for time durations.
